intro: Silene gracilicaulis, commonly known as the slender stalked catchfly, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its slender stems and delicate leaves contribute to its graceful appearance, while its seeds are dispersed by wind. Silene gracilicaulis plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native environment.
